e017dfa3-c063-4875-8336-cae8b4a9b903.description: The Casino Blackjack Badge is issued to students who successfully complete the 80 hour course entitled Casino Blackjack Dealer (COO-370) at the Anne Arundel Community College Dealer School. In order to earn this badge, students must demonstrate proficiency in terms of card handling, cheque handling, payouts, and customer service.
e017dfa3-c063-4875-8336-cae8b4a9b903.name: Casino Blackjack

issuer.summary: issued by Anne Arundel Community College

alignments.name: Card Handling
alignments.description: Demonstrate the ability to efficiently spread 52 cards; Shuffle eight decks of cards in under two minutes; Consistently apply proper game protection skills; Demonstrate the ability to properly “load" a six deck shoe

alignments.name: Cheque Handling
alignments.description: Demonstrate knowledge of the “cutting” and “plucking”; Apply appropriate cheque cutting and change procedures; Accurately "run down" 20 cheques in less than 10 seconds; Apply excellent table float management skills

alignments.name: Blackjack Payouts
alignments.description: Calculate accurate payouts for splits and double downs; Accurately pay each bonus bet in under 30 seconds; Calculate insurance maximum in under 10 seconds; Accurately "break down" bets and pay correct amounts

alignments.name: Blackjack Customer Service
alignments.description: Entertain and engage up to six guests at one time; Apply excellent customer service skills; Demonstrate communication through clear hand signals; Efficiently deal a shoe of six decks in less than 10 minutes

badge_template_activities.title: Successful Course Completion:  Casino Blackjack

95c26b02-f29e-4f41-86d1-bbf030e38d2d.description: The Carnival Games Badge is issued to students who successfully complete the 48 hour course entitled Casino Carnival Games Dealer (CLI-356) at the Anne Arundel Community College Dealer School. In order to earn this badge, students must demonstrate proficiency dealing Mississippi Stud, Ultimate Texas Hold'Em, Let It Ride, Three Card Poker & Four Card Poker.
95c26b02-f29e-4f41-86d1-bbf030e38d2d.name: Carnival Games

issuer.summary: issued by Anne Arundel Community College

alignments.name: Card Handling
alignments.description: Demonstrate ability to efficiently spread 52 cards; Ability to perform shuffle procedure in less than 1 minute; Consistently apply proper game protection skill; Recognize card irregularity and inform supervisor

alignments.name: Cheque Handling
alignments.description: Accurately pay each hand in less than 10 seconds; Apply excellent float management skills; Ability to "break down" bets in less than 10 seconds; Recognize poker hand rankings and proper payouts

alignments.name: Payouts
alignments.description: Calculate each bonus payout in less than 10 seconds; Ensure customers make accurately timed bets; Accurately compare hands and pay proper amounts; Perform several calculations for each player per round

alignments.name: Customer Service
alignments.description: Entertain and engage up to six guests at one time; Apply excellent customer service skills; Demonstrate communication through clear hand signals Efficiently deal to up to six spots in less than 25 seconds.

badge_template_activities.title: Successful Course Completion:  Casino Carnival Games Dealer

f855ec96-9928-4dea-8e69-0479d184a632.description: The Mini Baccarat Badge is issued to students who successfully complete the 40 hour course entitled Mini Baccarat Dealer (COO-397) at the Anne Arundel Community College Dealer School. In order to earn this badge, students must demonstrate proficiency in terms of card handling, cheque handling, payouts, and customer service.
f855ec96-9928-4dea-8e69-0479d184a632.name: Mini Baccarat

issuer.summary: issued by Anne Arundel Community College

alignments.name: Card Handling
alignments.description: Demonstrate knowledge of the third card rule; Shuffle eight decks of cards in under two minutes; Consistently apply proper game protection skills; Demonstrate ability to properly "load" an eight deck shoe.

alignments.name: Cheque Handling
alignments.description: Subtract the amount of commission from the Banker bet; Apply excellent table float management skills; Accurately make change in under 30 seconds; Accurately "run down" 20 cheques in less than 8 seconds

alignments.name: Payouts
alignments.description: Calculate accurate payouts for winning tie wagers; Accurately pay each bonus bet in under 20 seconds; Calculate Banker commission in under 10 seconds; Accurately "break down" bets and pay correct amounts

alignments.name: Customer Service
alignments.description: Engage and entertain up to 9 seated guests at one time; Apply excellent customer service skills; Apply clear verbal communication for accepting wagers; Efficiently deal a hand in under 10 seconds

badge_template_activities.title: Successful Course Completion:  Mini Baccarat Dealer

bf2eb831-4b06-414f-8804-a621eda17b18.description: Continuing Education and Workforce Development (CEWD) Advance held June 1, 2015 recognizes the successful participation in professional development activities and synergistic opportunities in the School of Continuing Education and Workforce Development.
bf2eb831-4b06-414f-8804-a621eda17b18.name: CEWD Advance 2015

issuer.summary: issued by Anne Arundel Community College

alignments.name: Shared Resources and Best Practices
alignments.description: Participants reviewed all areas and departments of Continuing Education and Workforce Development to share resources and best practices.

alignments.name: Strategic Priorities
alignments.description: Participants applied the strategic priorities for CEWD as outlined by leadership to identify innovative, forward thinking and growth minded strategies to enhance all of the work within Continuing Education and Workforce Development.

alignments.name: Collaborative Interdepartmental SMART Goals
alignments.description: Participants created SMART goal that included collaborative, interdepartmental teams within CEWD.

badge_template_activities.title: Review, Apply, and Create at the 2015 CEWD Advance

59fe1328-1e1e-4278-a11b-91320b5e73ba.description: OCA 559 Radio Frequency Spectrum Management is a comprehensive course that will provide high-level fluency, competency and problem-solving techniques required in spectrum management. Spectrum-related topics will allow students to interrelate the legal, regulatory, technical and economic aspects that aid in the decision making process involved in spectrum management.
59fe1328-1e1e-4278-a11b-91320b5e73ba.name: Radio Frequency Spectrum Management

issuer.summary: issued by Anne Arundel Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrated a fluency in important terms and definitions and spectrum management fundamentals.
Demonstrated a fluency in the organization and spectrum regulations of international treaty and U. S. regulatory agencies.
Demonstrated a fluency using the table of frequency allocations.
Demonstrated a fluency in how spectrum is allocated and frequencies allotted.
Demonstrated a fluency assignment and licensing procedures.
Demonstrated a fluency in equipment approval processes and systems certifications.
Demonstrated a fluency in spectrum mathematics.
Demonstrated a fluency in radiowave propagation.
Demonstrated a fluency in antennas for spectrum managers.
Demonstrated a fluency in technical standards.
Demonstrated a fluency in spectrum efficiency.
Demonstrated a fluency in fees and auctions.
Demonstrated a fluency in spectrum sharing techniques and current "hot" topics.

c677cac7-6a76-4d0f-be0b-21fc198b69db.description: Anne Arundel Community College in partnership with the Business Network for Offshore Wind to recognize attendees of the 2015 International Offshore Wind Forum held September 27 - 28, 2015 at Pier V Hotel in Baltimore, Maryland. The badge is issued to those who demonstrate a commitment to establishing the U.S. offshore wind supply chain industry by sharing and exchanging technical information and establishing partnerships.
c677cac7-6a76-4d0f-be0b-21fc198b69db.name: 2015 International Offshore Wind Forum

issuer.summary: issued by Anne Arundel Community College

alignments.name: Offshore Foundation to Blade
alignments.description: Class taught at the Maritime Institute

badge_template_activities.title: Attendee has completed at least three of the five criteria listed below
Leadership - Sponsor the International Offshore Wind Partnering Forum and/or become a Network member
Expertise - Presenting technical information to increase the body of offshore wind knowledge; or apply information learned in your business
Relationship Building - Participate in WindMatch or meeting a potential partner and conducting follow-up within two weeks of the Forum

Communication - Provide feedback to improve future Forums by filling out the participant survey; and/or inform the Network of partnering outcomes and success stories; provide the Network with a one to two sentence quote about your IPF experience
Networking - Facilitate an introduction between companies in order to grow the industry

de81ba3d-d6d2-4a20-a3aa-8524f589ec96.description: ESL 405: English as a Second Language for Food Service is a 40-hour, 10-week class for restaurant employees at Maryland Live Casino. The purpose of the course is to increase the students' confidence and fluency using English to serve customers in a restaurant, communicate with cooks, casino staff and management.
de81ba3d-d6d2-4a20-a3aa-8524f589ec96.name: ESL 405: English as a Second Language for Food Service

issuer.summary: issued by Anne Arundel Community College

alignments.name: Intercultural Communication
alignments.description: Recognize how cultural differences impact communication.

alignments.name: Listening Skills
alignments.description: Develop active listening skills and strategies for efficient communication with co-workers and customers.

alignments.name: Vocabulary
alignments.description: Identify and improve vocabulary and language skills to maximize communication and customer satisfaction.

alignments.name: Oral Proficiency
alignments.description: Increase oral proficiency to interact with co-workers and customers, and to describe the menu items and their essential ingredients.

badge_template_activities.title: 80% Attendance is required
Successfully complete role play involving customer orders and requests
Successfully complete simulations of typical problems and complaints
Successfully describe menu items and main ingredients
Practice clear communication in a restaurant setting
Give demonstration of restaurant etiquette

100b806b-4c68-4ad2-92e1-3ee703c02ede.description: Cybersecurity is not something that can be achieved through technology alone. The human factor is a critical component. Understanding the risks and employing strategies to minimize them is essential both in the workplace and at home.
100b806b-4c68-4ad2-92e1-3ee703c02ede.name: Cyber Safety

issuer.summary: issued by Anne Arundel Community College

alignments.name: Password Security
alignments.description: Student demonstrates knowledge of strategies used to keep accounts and data safe including the use of secure passwords and an understanding of two factor authentication.

alignments.name: Social Engineering
alignments.description: Student is able to identify the threats of social engineering and employ strategies used to avoid becoming a victim.

alignments.name: Mobile Security
alignments.description: Student demonstrates knowledge of mobile device security including strategies to decrease risks and an understanding of how the user's actions impact computer security.

alignments.name: Online Security
alignments.description: Student demonstrates understanding of the importance of online security by employing strategies to interact securely online in both personal and work environments.

alignments.name: Computer Security
alignments.description: Student demonstrates an understanding of computer security and its importance including how to secure a computer and the ability to identify actions affect computer security.

alignments.name: Wi-Fi Security
alignments.description: Student can identify the difference between open versus private Wi-Fi and demonstrate knowledge of how to secure Wi-Fi.

alignments.name: Network and Cloud Security
alignments.description: Student can articulate what the "cloud" is and identify strategies to navigate it more securely.  Student is able to demonstrate an understanding of actions that impact network security and related best practices.

alignments.name: Data Integrity and Destruction
alignments.description: Student is able to distinguish physical and logical data.  Student demonstrates an understanding of ways in which data integrity can be maintained and ways to safely destroy data.

alignments.name: Workplace Security
alignments.description: Student can identify actions that affect workplace security and best practices to make the workplace more secure.

badge_template_activities.title: The Cyber Safety Badge is issued to students who demonstrate an understanding of Cybersecurity best practices such that they can implement them in personal and workplace settings.

1797bb32-dbe8-49a0-bbd6-91c40439d745.description: Anne Arundel Community College in partnership with Arundel High School to recognize attendees for participating in the Adventure held in the Center for Applied Learning and Technology at Anne Arundel Community College on August 28, 2017. The badge is issued to those who demonstrate a understanding of the value of Continuing Education Certificates and Digital Badging as workforce credentials.
1797bb32-dbe8-49a0-bbd6-91c40439d745.name: Continuing Education Certificates and Digital Badges

issuer.summary: issued by Anne Arundel Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Attendee has attended the Adventure topic Continuing Education Certificates held at Anne Arundel Community College.

Continuing Education Certificates - Demonstrate an understanding of how Continuing Education Certificates provide students with the opportunity to build in-demand skills to meet the needs of the local business and industry.

Digital Credentials - Demonstrate an understanding of Digital Badges and the value that lies in the ability to assemble evidence of different granularity and from different sources - diverse ways to gather proof of competence.

Collaboration - Anne Arundel Community College working with Arundel High School will provide resources for students and parents to focus on Continuing Education's professional certificate programs that can help students reach their goals in a fairly short period of time and with affordable tuition. The courses are taught by faculty members with extensive experience in their fields and a commitment to helping students be successful and gainfully employed.

03d5d1a8-bf56-4c81-8cee-ddba0e33ec04.description: Provided instruction on the fundamental skills needed to enter the electrical trade as a helper. Topics include orientation to the electrical trade, electrical safety, basic construction math, and introduction to hand and power, electrical theory, fundamentals of residential and commercial wiring, and point of sales counter skills.
03d5d1a8-bf56-4c81-8cee-ddba0e33ec04.name: Electrical Helper I

issuer.summary: issued by Anne Arundel Community College

alignments.name: Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA)
alignments.description: The OSHA Outreach Training Program for the Construction Industry provides training for workers and employers on the recognition, avoidance, abatement, and prevention of safety and health hazards in workplaces in the construction industry.

badge_template_activities.title: Discuss the brief history of the electrical trades and the career opportunities available.
Demonstrate an understanding of electrical safety including the completion of a ten-hour OSHA-10 construction safety and health course.
Demonstrate an understanding of construction math.
Identify and use basic hand and power tools needed for the trade.
Demonstrate an understanding of fundamental residential and commercial wiring techniques.
Demonstrate an understanding of series, parallel, and series-parallel circuits.
Demonstrate an understanding of point of sale counter protocols

06a37ff1-1830-48c8-80ec-2b28a0b70557.description: This badge is earned by professionals in the hospitality career who show ability to connect with guests, take initiative, exhibit empathy and are capable of follow-through.

58f449dd-9572-475a-b3a6-d38735ed25ce.description: LEAD AACC is a year-long education and development program for faculty and staff currently in leadership roles that aspire to the highest levels of leadership and ensure AACC remains among the best community colleges in the nation.
58f449dd-9572-475a-b3a6-d38735ed25ce.name: LEAD AACC

issuer.summary: issued by Anne Arundel Community College

alignments.name: Decision making
alignments.description: Makes good decisions based on a mixture of analysis, wisdom, experience and judgment in a timely manner.

alignments.name: Motivating and inspiring others
alignments.description: Creates a climate in which people want to do their best. Empowers others by pushing tasks and decisions down.

alignments.name: Integrity and Trust
alignments.description: Seen as a direct and truthful person. Can present the unvarnished truth in an appropriate and helpful manner.

alignments.name: Collaboration
alignments.description: Can quickly find common ground and solve problems for the good of all. Can represent own interests yet be fair to other perspectives.

alignments.name: Innovation
alignments.description: Has good judgment about which creative ideas and suggestions will work. Open to the creative suggestions of others.

alignments.name: Managing Vision & Purpose
alignments.description: Communicates a compelling and inspired sense of core purpose. Talks beyond today about possibilities in the future.

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of all homework assignments
Active participation in LEAD activities
Completion of capstone project

6b35918e-ce31-4f52-a4bb-011ddc5736ec.description: Electronics are an integral part of daily life but what is inside of them? Students will explore a multitude of different circuits using lights, sounds, sensors, radio waves, and Boolean logic.  Topics include using volt meters, reading and writing electrical diagrams as well as building a working AM/FM radio.
6b35918e-ce31-4f52-a4bb-011ddc5736ec.name: Resisters and Radios

issuer.summary: issued by Anne Arundel Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Identify electronic components.
Read and draw electrical diagrams of the circuits.
Assemble circuits based on simplified and complex circuit diagrams.
Describe the function of the electrical components used.
Create truth tables based on basic Boolean logic.
Complete a large compound circuit with 100% accuracy.

54353084-7f00-42a9-a7f9-885b8ad6e30f.description: This course brings the high tech world of rocketry and robotics down to earth.  Students work in small teams to write a step-by-step program to make robots spin, light-up and play music. Topics include building and exploring machines and mechanisms and understanding concepts to design a rocket .
54353084-7f00-42a9-a7f9-885b8ad6e30f.name: Rockets and Robotics

issuer.summary: issued by Anne Arundel Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Program a robotic car to follow a maze course using LOGO programming language.
Use math and measurement skills to program a robotic car.
Program a pico cricket interactive circuit board using the LOGO programming language.
Design and build a  bottle rocket.
Apply Newton's law to the motion to rockets.

alignments.name: Prioritizing Tasks
alignments.description: Use a matrix and strategies to identify, prioritize, and handle key tasks, crises, interruptions and distractions in a manner that increases performance on key tasks.

alignments.name: Scheduling and Organizing
alignments.description: Apply techniques to schedule time and arrange physical, mental and online work spaces to get the employer’s most important priorities done. Successfully apply the rules and exceptions governing what constitutes "on time" in the workplace.

alignments.name: Maintaining Focus
alignments.description: Employ tactics to build and improve the ability to maintain focus, replace ineffective multi-tasking with focused, serial mono-tasking, and avoid procrastination to increase dependability and productivity.

badge_template_activities.title: Attend and participate in a 90-minute+ interactive workshop
Complete the Dependability module
Demonstrate comprehension and application by completing the “Delivering Workplace Excellence” Worksheet

8140281a-4e48-4384-ae26-6750f1f08e3e.description: Individuals who demonstrate the standards listed below through the completion of CTR-395 Command Line and Scripting, CTU-322 Network Analysis with Wireshark and CTU 323 Python for Network Security, will be issued a Network Analysis Tools digital badge. This badge signifies that the holder has the practical knowledge, skills and abilities to use industry standard tools to perform everyday network networking and computing tasks, analyze network traffic and improve network security.
8140281a-4e48-4384-ae26-6750f1f08e3e.name: Network Analysis Tools

issuer.summary: issued by Anne Arundel Community College

alignments.name: Command Line and Scripting
alignments.description: Demonstrate how to use common network tools, Linux command lines and Windows command lines to perform everyday network administration tasks and incorporate scripting to improve efficiency.

alignments.name: Network Analysis with Wireshark
alignments.description: Successfully use Wireshark to analyze network traffic and identify vulnerabilities, demonstrate skill in using protocol analyzers and independently perform packet-level analysis.

alignments.name: Python for Network Security Analysts
alignments.description: Show a practical understanding of the Python programming language by to developing custom tools using third-party libraries to solve network analysis and network security problems.

badge_template_activities.title: CTR-395 Command Line and Scripting: This continuing education course is designed for individuals pursuing professional development training in command line and scripting, and provides instruction on command line usage for everyday tasks. Topics include command line usage for Windows and Linux for everyday tasks.

CTU-322 Network Analysis with Wireshark: Learn practical network traffic and packet analysis tools practitioners use to monitor and secure networks. Explore the fundamentals of packet sniffing including protocols, collection, analysis, security-based analysis as well as others. Practice capturing and working with packets by using Wireshark in hands-on scenario based lab activities.

CTU 323 Python for Network Security Analysts: Use Python for network analysis and security applications by exploring third-party libraries for network analysis, penetration testing and wireless security. Through guided scenario-based lab activities build a tool kit you can start using right away to solve real-world network security problems. Learn the basics of Python programming, how to use third-party libraries, and build the foundational skills you need to start writing your own scripts.

203fb3f4-cf32-4e68-a75f-195e9b601a0d.description: PRESENTability focuses on effectively maximizing time and managing priorities in the workplace to maintain focus and productivity.

a95b7ce0-e970-4d51-9508-06954bb33775.description: SharePoint Champions serve a very important role in an organization's SharePoint environment. A SharePoint Champion serves as the "SharePoint expert" without necessarily having to be a developer, administrator, or even belong to the IT department. SharePoint Champions are power users with an in depth knowledge of the SharePoint features and functionalities.
a95b7ce0-e970-4d51-9508-06954bb33775.name: SharePoint Champion

issuer.summary: issued by Anne Arundel Community College

alignments.name: Communication
alignments.description: Communicate the basic functionality of SharePoint and the benefits of a SharePoint solution being utilized within an organization's department.

alignments.name: Organization
alignments.description: Create a well structured site by identifying how users need to use SharePoint and sorting users into appropriate groups.

alignments.name: Business Process Understanding
alignments.description: Identify how to improve business processes and determine when a process cannot be improved using SharePoint.

alignments.name: Security
alignments.description: Develop a well thought-out security hierarchy within site collections and sub sites.

badge_template_activities.title: ONH-374 MS SharePoint Server 2013 for the Power User:  Learn how to manage the team collaboration, document management and social features of SharePoint 2013.

5d7c9b79-1dc3-4e9d-a5c4-00815316c176.description: SUITability focuses on appreciating the importance of culture in the workplace, and teaches how to learn and fit into the culture of the company and department.
5d7c9b79-1dc3-4e9d-a5c4-00815316c176.name: Suitability

issuer.summary: issued by Anne Arundel Community College

alignments.name: Cultural Understanding
alignments.description: Build understanding of workplace and company culture, how it is shaped and why it is important.

alignments.name: Learning the Culture
alignments.description: Apply approaches and practices to learn the culture of the workplace, industry, company, and department.

alignments.name: Adopting the Culture
alignments.description: Employ approaches to adopt the culture of the workplace, industry, company, and department in order to fit-in.

badge_template_activities.title: Attend and participate in a 90-minute+ interactive workshop
Complete the Suitability module
Demonstrate comprehension and application by completing the “Delivering Workplace Excellence” Worksheet

dd2091f6-9bfc-4f91-bc1d-13dab654c31a.description: TRANSITIONability focuses on preparing for and executing a smooth job transition when entering or moving within the workforce.
dd2091f6-9bfc-4f91-bc1d-13dab654c31a.name: Transitionability

issuer.summary: issued by Anne Arundel Community College

alignments.name: Transition Preparation Skills
alignments.description: Use framework to identify what is needed for a smooth transition regarding basics, job search prep and execution and work. Apply strategies to plan ahead for meals, clothing, and transport upon transitioning into work or a new job.

alignments.name: Life/Work Balance
alignments.description: Employ strategies to establish and maintain restorative balance upon transitioning into work or a new job, including self-care and support.

alignments.name: Strong Job Start Skills
alignments.description: Implement approaches to make the most of employment orientation, making a strong first impression when introduced to and getting to know co-workers. Apply strategies to increase success in the first 9 days on the job including understanding and meeting expectations, establishing engagement, learning the culture, getting to know the team & planning.

badge_template_activities.title: Attend and participate in a 90-minute+ interactive workshop
Complete the Transitionability module
Demonstrate comprehension and application by completing the “Delivering Workplace Excellence” Worksheet

873142f2-a6df-439b-b2f6-394d3415d319.description: WORKability focuses on understanding how business works, why job exists and what employers care about in order to respond to the realities, exceed the expectations, and positively impact the bottom-line in today’s workplace.
873142f2-a6df-439b-b2f6-394d3415d319.name: Workability

issuer.summary: issued by Anne Arundel Community College

alignments.name: Increasing The Employer’s Profit
alignments.description: Use framework to understand how profit works, how their employer generates income, how workers can make, save, and cost the company money, and how their job impacts the bottom-line. Apply strategies to cover the cost of employing them and generate profit for their employer.

alignments.name: Today’s Realities & Expectations
alignments.description: Implement approaches to deliver the basics, succeed in meeting within the subtle and often unwritten rules of the workplace, effectively respond the realities, and consistently exceed the expectations of today’s employers.

badge_template_activities.title: Attend and participate in a 90-minute+ interactive workshop
Complete the Workability module
Demonstrate comprehension and application by completing the “Delivering Workplace Excellence” Worksheet

1e88f0ec-2aa3-44d5-9a16-23eebd4db14a.description: Completion of all 10 Workplace Excellence modules
1e88f0ec-2aa3-44d5-9a16-23eebd4db14a.name: Workplace Excellence Black Belt

issuer.summary: issued by Anne Arundel Community College

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of all 10 Workplace Excellence modules

521f069e-6619-4cb2-b95b-c4fb05532a51.description: WRITEability focuses on crafting and delivering effective written communication in the workplace. What it takes to earn this badge
521f069e-6619-4cb2-b95b-c4fb05532a51.name: Writeability

issuer.summary: issued by Anne Arundel Community College

alignments.name: Basic Writing Skills
alignments.description: Apply basic writing skills, including using traditional and emerging rules, to enhance communication.

alignments.name: Crafting Written Messages
alignments.description: Use a system of five key questions to craft effective written messages. Employ techniques to write clear, concise, professional email messages.

alignments.name: Social Media & Texting Skills
alignments.description: Apply techniques to appropriately use social media and texting in the workplace, including Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn.

badge_template_activities.title: Attend and participate in a 90-minute+ interactive workshop
Complete the Writeability module
Demonstrate comprehension and application by completing the “Delivering Workplace Excellence” Worksheet
